title: How to publish a book without using my name on Amazon Kindle - Quora

response.answer_text: You already have your answers here, which I agree with, so I’ll just add: Be sure to search for any pen name you plan to use. First, you don’t want confusion with another author of the same name, especially if you don’t want to be associated with their books. Second, it’s disrespectful to intentionally take on a pen name that happens to be the name of another author. Doing a Google and Amazon search of whatever names you consider (and going 10 pages deep into the results) should be enough to reasonably confirm your desired pen name is original. Oh, and don’t make it weird or funny — like I.P. Daily — unless that fits the nature of your book. The point isn’t to call attention to your name. [Answered: How can I publish a book without using my name on Amazon Kindle?]

Amazon allows you to remain anonymous. For the name invent a pseudonym and use it in both setup time and inside the manuscript. I personally hate to put annon on the cover, it is always better the classic approach, invent a name to use as the author. That is what our predecessors, writers used to do!

You can write under a pen name - you may have to provide evidence the material is yours but if you go through the help on KDP you should be able to find out their requirements. You will have to provide actual name to receive payments.

Amazon has a section in your dashboard that will allow you to use a pseudonym, including the “publisher” section. Authors use that area for their small press name, as well. The same goes for other POD platforms.
Choose another name and put it on the book. The only reason your real name is necessary is so that you can receive payment. Amazon does not publish it.
You can use a pen name….
